title: Font used on Inkd.com and or iloveny.com
content:
Hi.. I am desparetly trying to find the font used in [http://www.inkd.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20090818174118/http:/www.inkd.com/) or [http:/www.iloveny.com](http:/www.iloveny.com). Its like a slab serif, Rockwell or so, but with more distinguished characteristics. For instance, the lowercase l, t and h are long in height.

I tried whatthefont and identifont, but no success here.

I am sure you guys can help me with this. Or maybe somebody can show me a perfect match free alternative, would be amazing..

I am bloody rookie in typography, but well there is always a start.

Thanks.

This is an example.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090818174118im_/http:/typophile.com/files/user_resources_faq_header_5688.gif)
author: theusualsuspect

comments.content:
That’s [Archer](http://web.archive.org/web/20090818174118/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100033).

Try the [Type ID Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20090818174118/http:/www.typophile.com/typeid) for posting stuff like this next time.

Again those Hoefler & Frere-Jones. I am already in love with Gotham..

Thanks Jan that was quick.. Next time I’ll use the correct Board, promise.
